header: ORDER IN BAIL APPLICATON NO.16/2019 (Krishna Yadav and other Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST010001672019

background.text: 1. Applicants have filed application for bail in C.R.No.11 of 2019 of Shahupuri Police Station registered against the accused in respect of offence punishable under Sections 304, 504, 506 of I.P.C. and Section 39 and 45 of Money Lending Act. Accused are in custody.

arguments.text: 2. Accused have filed application on the ground that, accused were in police custody till 9/01/2019 and thereafter they are in MCR. The allegation against the applicant accused is in respect of running bhisi. Informant's husband had withdrawn the entire amount he had deposited in bhisi. There is no evidence of abatement by the accused. The custody of accused will serve no purpose and they are ready to furnish bail and to abide the conditions imposed.

argumentSentences.text: Accused have filed application on the ground that, accused were in police custody till 9/01/2019 and thereafter they are in MCR.
The allegation against the applicant accused is in respect of running bhisi.
Informant's husband had withdrawn the entire amount he had deposited in bhisi.
There is no evidence of abatement by the accused.
The custody of accused will serve no purpose and they are ready to furnish bail and to abide the conditions imposed.

arguments.text: 3. Heard Advocate Shri.Dhaygudge. Advocate for accused pointed out FIR and submitted that, no offence is made out of abatement to commit suicide. It is pointed out that anticipatory bail is granted to the other accused. Accused are the local residents. Advocate for accused pointed out the ration card of accused Krishna Yadav and the bonafide certificate of his daughters. It is submitted that, accused Lalji Prajapati is resident of Guruwar Peth, Satara

argumentSentences.text: Advocate for accused pointed out FIR and submitted that, no offence is made out of abatement to commit suicide.
It is pointed out that anticipatory bail is granted to the other accused.
Advocate for accused pointed out the ration card of accused Krishna Yadav and the bonafide certificate of his daughters.
It is submitted that, accused Lalji Prajapati is resident of Guruwar Peth, Satara

arguments.text: 4. Considering the grounds and submissions, I have to mention here that, accused were available for custodial interrogation. Considering the nature of offence no purpose will be served by keeping the accused behind bar, nothing is to be recovered from the accused. Hence, accused may be granted bail by imposing conditions.

argumentSentences.text: Considering the grounds and submissions, I have to mention here that, accused were available for custodial interrogation.
Considering the nature of offence no purpose will be served by keeping the accused behind bar, nothing is to be recovered from the accused.
Hence, accused may be granted bail by imposing conditions.

order.text: ORDER 1. Application is allowed. 2. Accused Krishna Ranglal Yadav, age 40 years, occupation Labour, r/o Hira Park, Shahupuri, Satara. Taluka and District Satara, Lalji Ramhark Prajapati Age 33 years, occupation Labour, r/o Guruwar Paraj, Satara, Taluka and District Satara who are in Magisterial Custody in C.R.No.11 of 2019 of Shahupuri Police Station Satara, be released on bail on furnishing P.R. of Rs.25,000/­ each with solvent surety of like amount. 3. Accused not to tamper with evidence of prosecution. Applicant shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. 4. Accused to assist in investigation and make available in whenever called by the investigating machine. 5. Bail in lower court.

footer: Place : Satara (B.S.Wavre) Date: 17/01/2019 Addl. Sessions Judge, Satara
processedText:
ORDER IN BAIL APPLICATON NO.16/2019 (Krishna Yadav and other Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST010001672019 
---header-ends---
1. Applicants have filed application for bail in C.R.No.11 of 2019 of Shahupuri Police Station registered against the accused in respect of offence punishable under Sections 304, 504, 506 of I.P.C. and Section 39 and 45 of Money Lending Act. Accused are in custody. 
---background-ends---
2. Accused have filed application on the ground that, accused were in police custody till 9/01/2019 and thereafter they are in MCR. The allegation against the applicant accused is in respect of running bhisi. Informant's husband had withdrawn the entire amount he had deposited in bhisi. There is no evidence of abatement by the accused. The custody of accused will serve no purpose and they are ready to furnish bail and to abide the conditions imposed. 
---argument-ends---
3. Heard Advocate Shri.Dhaygudge. Advocate for accused pointed out FIR and submitted that, no offence is made out of abatement to commit suicide. It is pointed out that anticipatory bail is granted to the other accused. Accused are the local residents. Advocate for accused pointed out the ration card of accused Krishna Yadav and the bonafide certificate of his daughters. It is submitted that, accused Lalji Prajapati is resident of Guruwar Peth, Satara 
---argument-ends---
4. Considering the grounds and submissions, I have to mention here that, accused were available for custodial interrogation. Considering the nature of offence no purpose will be served by keeping the accused behind bar, nothing is to be recovered from the accused. Hence, accused may be granted bail by imposing conditions. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1. Application is allowed. 2. Accused Krishna Ranglal Yadav, age 40 years, occupation Labour, r/o Hira Park, Shahupuri, Satara. Taluka and District Satara, Lalji Ramhark Prajapati Age 33 years, occupation Labour, r/o Guruwar Paraj, Satara, Taluka and District Satara who are in Magisterial Custody in C.R.No.11 of 2019 of Shahupuri Police Station Satara, be released on bail on furnishing P.R. of Rs.25,000/­ each with solvent surety of like amount. 3. Accused not to tamper with evidence of prosecution. Applicant shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. 4. Accused to assist in investigation and make available in whenever called by the investigating machine. 5. Bail in lower court. 
---order-ends---
Place : Satara (B.S.Wavre) Date: 17/01/2019 Addl. Sessions Judge, Satara
